paper_metadata.title: BRCA2 mutations in familial breast cancer with prostate cancer: a case report and literature review
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports on BRCA2 mutations in a family with a history of breast and prostate cancer, detailing specific variants, penetrance data, and individual cases.

patients.phenotype: prostate cancer in proband; breast cancer in daughter

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient was a 74-year-old Chinese male who was first admitted to the hospital in October 2021 with acute right-sided chest pain and a palpable right breast lump.

individual_records.phenotype_details: BRCA2 mutation carrier, prostate cancer risk
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic testing of the patient’s son and daughter showed that they were also carriers of the BRCA2 mutation.
The results of the genetic testing of the patient’s daughter were similar to those of the index case, with the same variant identified.

functional_data.summary: The c.5987dupC variant results in a frameshift mutation leading to a premature termination codon.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.population_frequency: Not identified in any large population database.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence for pathogenicity based on family history and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The variant has not been previously reported in large population databases.
key_quotes: Notably, the variant BRCA2:c.5987dup(p.Arg1997fs) found in the patient’s son has not been reported before.
The patient’s genetic testing revealed the presence of a BRCA2 gene mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
